Documentation

CSV2JSON is a high-performance converter that transforms CSV data into JSON format at lightning speed.

Quick Start

Get started with CSV2JSON in three ways: Web interface, REST API, or CLI tool.

Web Interface

Visit the converter app to upload and convert files directly in your browser.

API Reference

POST /upload

Convert a CSV file to JSON format.

Parameters

Parameter Type Description
file File CSV file to convert
delimiter String Field delimiter (default: ",")
output_format String "array" or "object"

Example Request

curl -X POST http://localhost:8080/upload \
-F "file=@data.csv" \
-F "delimiter=," \
-F "output_format=array"

CLI Tool

Use CSV2JSON from the command line for batch processing and automation.

Installation

go install github.com/yourorg/csv2json@latest

Usage

csv2json -i input.csv -o output.json
csv2json -server # Start web server

Examples

Basic Conversion

Convert a simple CSV file:

Input CSV

name,age,city
John,30,New York
Jane,25,Boston

Output JSON

[
{"name": "John", "age": 30, "city": "New York"},
{"name": "Jane", "age": 25, "city": "Boston"}
]

FAQ

What file formats are supported?

CSV2JSON supports standard CSV files with customizable delimiters including comma, semicolon, tab, and pipe.

What's the maximum file size?

The system supports files up to 2GB in size. Large files are automatically streamed for optimal memory usage.

How fast is the conversion?

CSV2JSON processes up to 270,000 rows per second using optimized Go algorithms and concurrent processing.
